snippet: The Advertising column in Business Day on Monday about a campaign by California utility regulators to tell consumers about deregulation misspelled the name of the Mad magazine character whose slogan ''What, me worry?'' was invoked by a critic of t...
lead_paragraph: The Advertising column in Business Day on Monday about a campaign by California utility regulators to tell consumers about deregulation misspelled the name of the Mad magazine character whose slogan ''What, me worry?'' was invoked by a critic of the campaign. It is Alfred E. Neuman, not Newman.
abstract: Correction of April 27 Advertising column about campaign by California utility regulators to tell consumers about deregulation
